page.title: 17ENTERTAINMENT IN CHELTENHAM
page.content: GLOUCESTERSHIRE ECHO. The local {newspaper}was established in 1878.It prints over 30,000 copies daily in three editions and employs about 100 people.Facing fierce competition from at least 4 free newspapers which rely heavily on local advertisers for their financial support. { CINEMA.}Of the nine cinemas Cheltenham once possessed only one remains. The Odeon was transformed from a church to a cinema in 1933. It has only recently been converted to a three screen cinema. Most popular film so far in 1985 - "Ghostbusters". Other cinemas in the town have been converted to Bingo or Snooker Halls. The ABC cinema, in the very centre of the town, has been empty and unused for several years whilst its future is debated hotly - various architectural schemes have been rejected.
